LongRunningOperationResult.description: The response model for a Long-Running Operations API.

operationId.description: The Id for this long-running operation.

status.description: The status state of the request.

values.description: The request has not started processing yet.
The request has one or more failures.

resourceLocation.description: The location URI for details about the created resource. This is only provided when the request was successfully completed.

ODataErrorResponse.description: This response object is returned when an error occurs in the Maps API.

ODataError.description: This object is returned when an error occurs in the Maps API.

message.description: If available, a human readable description of the error.

target.description: If available, the target causing the error.

BatchResponse.description: This object is returned from a successful Batch service call

successfulRequests.description: Number of successful requests in the batch

totalRequests.description: Total number of requests in the batch

CoordinateAbbreviated.description: A location represented as a latitude and longitude.

Geometry.description: This represents the geometry for one or more geographical features (parks, state boundary etc.) and should be a `GeoJSON` compliant type. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946) for details.

GeoJSONGeometry.description: A valid `GeoJSON` geometry object. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1) for details.

type.description: Specifies the `GeoJSON` geometry type. Must be one of the seven valid GeoJSON geometry types - Point, MultiPoint, LineString, MultiLineString, Polygon, MultiPolygon and GeometryCollection.

MultiPoint.description: A valid `GeoJSON MultiPoint` geometry type. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.3) for details.

LineString.description: A valid `GeoJSON LineString` geometry type. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.4) for details.

GeoJSONLinearRing.description: Though a linear ring is not explicitly represented as a GeoJSON geometry type, it helps in defining the polygon as an array of linear rings. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.6) for details.

GeoJSONPosition.description: A valid `GeoJSON Position` geometry type. A `Position` is an array of numbers with two or more elements. The first two elements are _longitude_ and _latitude_, precisely in that order. _Altitude/Elevation_ is an optional third element. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.1) for details.

Point.description: A valid `GeoJSON Point` geometry type. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.2) for details.

MultiPolygon.description: A valid `GeoJSON MultiPolygon` object type. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.7) for details.

coordinates.description: Contains a list of valid `GeoJSON` Polygon objects. **Note** that coordinates in GeoJSON are in x, y order (longitude, latitude).

Polygon.description: A valid `GeoJSON Polygon` geometry type. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.6) for details.

GeoJSONGeometryCollection.description: A valid `GeoJSON GeometryCollection` object type. Please refer to [RFC 7946](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.8) for details.

geometries.description: Contains a list of valid `GeoJSON` geometry objects. **Note** that coordinates in GeoJSON are in x, y order (longitude, latitude).

BatchRequestBody.description: This type represents the request body for the Batch service.

batchItems.description: The list of queries/requests to process

Coordinate.description: A location represented as a latitude and longitude.

SubscriptionKey.name: subscription-key
SubscriptionKey.description: One of the Azure Maps keys provided from an Azure Map Account. Please refer to this [article](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-maps/how-to-manage-authentication) for details on how to manage authentication.

ApiVersion.name: api-version
ApiVersion.description: Version number of Azure Maps API. Current version is 1.0

ClientId.name: x-ms-client-id
ClientId.description: Specifies which account is intended for usage in conjunction with the Azure AD security model.  It represents a unique ID for the Azure Maps account and can be retrieved from Azure Maps management  plane Account API. To use Azure AD security in Azure Maps see the following [articles](https://aka.ms/amauthdetails) for guidance.

JsonFormat.name: format
JsonFormat.description: Desired format of the response. Only `json` format is supported.

400.description: Bad request: one or more parameters were incorrectly specified or are mutually exclusive.

401.description: Access denied due to invalid subscription key or invalid Azure Active Directory bearer token.  Make sure to provide a valid key for an active Azure subscription and Maps resource.  Otherwise, verify the [WWW-Authenticate](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750#section-3.1) header for error code and description of the provided AAD bearer token.

WWW-Authenticate.description: Bearer realm="https://atlas.microsoft.com/", error="invalid_token", error_description="The access token expired"

404.description: Not Found: the requested resource could not be found, but it may be available again in the future.

409.description: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource. Likely caused by a parallel update to the same resource.

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request. Please try again later.

201Async.description: The resource has been created successfully.

Location.description: A URI where details on the newly created resource can be found.

202Async.description:
**Supported only for async request.**
Request Accepted: The request has been accepted for processing. Please use the URL in the Location Header to retry or access the results.

Location.description: New URL to check for the results of the long running process.
